intro: Trichodesma oleifolium, commonly known as the African chia or wild chia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and linear, aromatic leaves. The plant is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, round seeds that are rich in oils and nutrients, making them valuable for both traditional and modern uses. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
